website_summaries.verdict: These twisted tent spikes are the perfect way to keep your tent securely in place, no matter how windy your campsite gets.
pros: Spiral design easily anchors into soft soil
Each is topped with convenient pull loop
cons: A little on the pricy side for just 4 tent stakes

customer_reviews.title: Was disappointed to see my tent flapping loose in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: Used these stakes, came back to my camp site later in the day, only to find my tent flapping in the breeze. Upon closer inspection, some POS had swiped my stakes, and to give the lowlifes partial credit, used their cheap steel tent stakes to replace mine, which pulled out in the wind. I guess it was better than letting my tent blow away, but not by much. So, take this as a recommendation, these stakes are good enough to steal. Not sure how one would combat that, other than catching them in the act.
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: and worked super well! We got caught in a hurricane during ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, and worked super well! We got caught in a hurricane during beach camping and had to take shelter in a more heavy duty tent, leaving my tent with just a few light bags inside. I thought all our stuff was done for, but these stakes worked like a charm! They stayed put and the tent was in place and intact by the time the storm stopped. The only issue is I wish they sold them in packs of different sizes-- my tent takes 5 stakes so I had to order two sets and now I have extras I don't know what to do with.
customer_reviews.author: MMB

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but they work
customer_reviews.text: These are my "special circumstance" stakes. Theyre too big and heavy to carry all the time. If there has been lots of rain, Ill carry a few with me. They hold really well when the ground has been saturated. If you pound these into hard clay, youre going to have to destroy the ground to get them back out. They hold that well.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Superior stakes!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful! I bought 1 pack originally and then after using them for the first time I ordered 2 more sets! They hold in the ground very well, and never have I lost one. There's been a couple times I've had to use a hammer to pry them out of the ground--they're that good! A tip, when you're pulling them out of the ground, twist them as you're pulling. They'll come out much easier that way. I've sustained winds of appropriately 50mph so far while camping, and these haven't budged. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive stakes
customer_reviews.text: These are incredible stakes. I was skeptical that they would be worth the expense but now am very glad I made this purchase. The stakes are being used on a family sized canopy on for our camper trailer. Wind kept pulling up the two other stake types we tried. The MSR Cyclone stakes didn't even budge. Honestly I was concerned I wouldn't be able to get them out of the ground when we left. However by pulling directly up they came out easily. Very impressed. Should have purchased these first.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Exteme gear for exteme conditions.
customer_reviews.text: Use these for tarp shelters. First i ever purchased. Bigger tarp so more stakes and these are outstanding. It may be some time before i have need to replace or re order, when that need arises THESE will be the stakes I purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Murry

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beach Camping
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to these stakes our tent was kept in place during a windy weekend at Assateague State park. The stakes did not move at all, even during a strong thunderstorm. I was thanking my lucky stars that we had purchased these to use instead of the standard hook stakes that come with most tents, as we had used those to help tie down the rain fly and were no match for the wind. I'm planning on purchasing an extra set for the next time we go beach camping.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I have used these stakes in the mountains and at ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these stakes in the mountains and at the beach, they hold extremely well. I ordered these after we lost our Coleman 10x10 with the big awning in a storm last year. The regular stakes that I have used came right up but these have held in different soil types in 20-30 mph winds.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Guranteed to work!
customer_reviews.text: AS advertised. Used for a month long vacation in the Caribbean during the Dec. Winter Winds.The sand pockets were of no match for the amazing trade winds. Luckily we also purchased some tent stakesWhich turned this into the most amazing beach blanket. No matter how much the wind blew the blanket never budged. At the end of day you had to work hard to remove from sand. Slight twist and hard pull was needed.
customer_reviews.author: Maracuja

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These are great stakes, even for use in the sand at the beach. Excellent replacements for the cheap, junky ones that camping equipment companies send with their products. Rated four stars instead of five only because they are overpriced at $24.
customer_reviews.author: FALCON

customer_reviews.title: Make No Mis-Stake, These Stakes Will Keep Your Tent/Canopy on the Ground!
customer_reviews.text: These things are bomb proof and perform as advertised. They will not come out of the ground when attached to a canopy and confronted by gale-force winds. Bring a hammer to pound them in and some additional parachute cord because the included cords will break. Also be careful with bare feet around these guys (and when pulling out of the ground)... sharp edges at the top where the parachute cord attaches.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Stakes
customer_reviews.text: Great tent stakes. They hold pretty darn well and the anodized treatment makes them pretty easy to clean off. For my smaller tents they work great and don't weigh too much. The usual tent I use these with is a mountain hardware trango 3. I tried them with my springbar tent and they didn't work so hot. The tent stake locations are metal hooks and I had trouble catching the hooks and holding them with these stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Chi_reader_2011

customer_reviews.title: Work in desert sand
customer_reviews.text: I live in the high desert and these stakes really worked after many others didn't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Diane N. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Strong!
customer_reviews.text: I went camping in the Alabama Hills, California and it gets super windy at night. These held my tent in place so I felt secured.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Just received the stakes and they are light but strong ...
customer_reviews.text: Paid $20 for four, and when I went to reorder they jacked up the price to $28. Instead, I found seven of the exact same stakes for $9.99.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeC.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in sand.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in the sand for some beach camping with calm weather, and they seemed secure enough to withstand a storm.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: They really do hold on for dear life, in any soil, in any weather. No point spending a fortune on a beautiful tent if your stakes or guylines come loose. These also work great when you're putting up a sun shelter on the beach.
customer_reviews.author: ConradColeridge

customer_reviews.title: Good stakes for more demanding conditions
customer_reviews.text: These are expensive, but they work. I'd like to find longer, thicker versions for big tents, but these provide really good holding power for their size. MSR does make good stuff. These are in keeping with that tradition.
customer_reviews.author: sumthin

customer_reviews.title: perfect for beach shelter
customer_reviews.text: Used these to hold down a beach shelter this summer - worked great even in 30 - 40 mph winds. Easy to drive into the sand, held fast, but also easy to pull out.
customer_reviews.author: lalyc

customer_reviews.title: Held good in sand but you have to drive them in at a greater angle than should be necessary---
customer_reviews.text: Held my tent good on the beach. I do wish the guyline hooks at the top of the stake were a little longer. You have to angle the stakes a good bit to keep your guyline from coming off
customer_reviews.author: tekt

customer_reviews.title: And they are fairly easy to insert into the sand and remove
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to keep our beach tent anchored on a windy day. And they are fairly easy to insert into the sand and remove. Highly recommend these for the beach.
customer_reviews.author: cpnytwenty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stakes!
customer_reviews.text: Great Stakes! Camped out at the beach for 2 days, they held firm. They don't weigh so much so I always include them in all camping trips because you never know what sort of grounds you'll be pitching on. The added bonus is that these are super long enough to use as a weapon in the event of a wild animal (or person) threatens to attack your campsite :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for beach tents!
customer_reviews.text: These thing are great. They held our tent down in the soft Gulf Coast sand exceptionally well. The little head on them is very small so bring something blunt to pound them into the harder sand with.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Lankford

customer_reviews.title: I bought two sets of these to pitch a tent ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these to pitch a tent on the beach. They are worth every penny! We had high winds (at night especially) and my tent didn't budge.. I watched several tents come out of the ground.. I was so grateful to not have to deal with chasing my tent down and re staking it.. Thank you MSR for making a stake that grips in loose sand so tight that you have to work a little bit to get them out! I used a rubber mallet to drive them in so I wouldn't do any damage to the tops.. Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Brannon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for use with our Quik Shade Tent for when we are using it at the beach. The stakes that are provided with the tent are fine, but it was pretty pricey, so I wanted to make sure that we have really solid stakes for security. These worked like a charm on a very windy beach day and were nice and easy to stake into the sand.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Shopaholic of Tampa Bay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing high quality stakes
customer_reviews.text: Amazing high quality stakes. Work perfectly for backpacking. They work great for a tent when conditions are windy, and super well for staking down our Kelty tarp in any type of soil. I rate these exceptional due to their swivel design because when you hit a rock it is able to move around it and still go in perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for desert camping, or anywhere sandy and windy
customer_reviews.text: Ater trying other stakes, the thin metal ones and the fat plastic ones, I ordered these and had them sent to me in the Middle East. Smply put: outstanding for sand and wind. Where the other ones pulled out of the ground in an instant, these did not budge. At all. I couldn't be happier with this purchase. Definitely need 2 packs if your tent fly needs its own stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Keeney

customer_reviews.title: super solid stakes
customer_reviews.text: super solid stakes. with the help of a plastic mallet I was able to bury the stake in the compacted coral base.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Gummy BearTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Nice extra security for tent
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, ended up using with a regular stake to have something to attach the loop on these to.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Burke

customer_reviews.title: Simply put these are awesome. The first use was on top of a ...
customer_reviews.text: Simply put these are awesome. The first use was on top of a lava flow field, very difficult terrain. To complicate matters a thunderstorm popped up about sundown with rain and wind gusts from 30-50mph. It lasted until about 3AM. The stakes did not loosen or give up. Out of seven tents ours was one of 3 that with stood the elements. DO NOT GO TENT CAMPING WITHOUT THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo User

customer_reviews.title: super light super strong
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They are super light but super strong! Before purchasing these I used the thick plastic yellow stakes which were a pain to get into the ground and don't hold in loose soil, these are much better
customer_reviews.author: ZachMac

customer_reviews.title: but once it's there it's a great hold.
customer_reviews.text: Held up perfectly in the beaches around San Diego. Takes more effort than you would think to get in deep in the sand, but once it's there it's a great hold.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Dubel

customer_reviews.title: Work better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: These things impressed me. I didn't expect them to work so well holding down a 10x10 ez-up at the beach. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great ... and works too!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a oversized beach umbrella with fold down sides. Always struggled with supplied stakes in compacted sand, never mind lose dry sand. This product works like a dream, would consider buy more if I need more than the 4pck.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great for sandy areas. But in hard surface you need a rock to get in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stake to hold tents down or Vampires, depending on your needs.
customer_reviews.text: My personal feeling regarding camping stakes that accompany new cheap or expensive tents alike, is that they are all destined for the landfills. I chose MSR cyclone stake even before using those pieces of garbage. Took this out the desert and found them to be awesome. We had high winds during our trip, these held down my tent so well, I felt as if it I was in a cabin. Second, these stakes look wicked enough to take down vampires. Who knows what's in the woods? Worth it, I recommend a buy.
customer_reviews.author: KBoo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are relatively lightweight for their size and they work verrrry well. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny O.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: These worked great in sandy soil to hold down a screen house with fabric loops.
customer_reviews.author: VelocityTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Holds so well you might think twice about using them. They should provide an extraction tool. LOL!
customer_reviews.author: jonny80s

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the beach
customer_reviews.text: We bought these stakes to secure our Kelty Cabana at the beach. They stay secure in the sand all day, even with a feisty sea breeze. Great product. Package of 6 would be an improvement to secure the flys.
customer_reviews.author: Bluezinb

customer_reviews.title: Successfully staked tent in beach sand
customer_reviews.text: I staked my tent with these on Vancouver Island, BC (Canada) beach sand on a 4-night backpacking hike. They held very tight and ensured my tent was stabe in wind and rain, and contributed to enjoyable trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They work perfectly for my tent. They stay put in sandy soil.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use in rocky ground and they have held up very well
customer_reviews.author: Robert M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: THESE WILL NOT COME OUT OF THE GROUND!!! Unless you want them to...
customer_reviews.author: Brian White

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant stakes, well made and tend to imbed themselves in the soil with perseverance
customer_reviews.author: Fastpayor

customer_reviews.title: Take Kit
customer_reviews.text: Only used these once so far when the weather turned. But they held really tight. I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are THE BOMB for securing tent stakes - just buy them already.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: These are good and simple to use. Easy to put into the ground and pull out. Would reccomend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. Have used them camping with our Boy Scout troop.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I found these
customer_reviews.text: During a high wind rainstorm on a sandy lake beach my tent stayed down when others went sideways. I'm glad I found these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Held down a tall 8 person tent in 25mph gusts in very sandy beach soil. Lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Liott

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent Stakes!
customer_reviews.text: These stakes are long and have excellent holding power in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kolacki

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great, light weight and quality. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: @DTOM _1775

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are solid, but too heavy for ultralight mountain tents.
customer_reviews.author: Israel Wick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best. But 'd be difficult to dig them out after the use.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Great desing but too short.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these specifically to anchor our umbrella at the beach (it has tie -downs). The reason we chose them was that they seemed to be the best rated for lose sand and the beach. These stakes are expensive too!! They would have been great if they would have been double the length, but they are truly too short for anchoring anything reliably in beach sand. The design is great, but they are simply too short to hold anything in beach sand. Don't spend this kind of money expecting them to work in lose soils or sand.
customer_reviews.author: Cheap-n-Easy

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: They pull out of sand too easily if it' windy.great in grass or dirt. Could be that the sand was powdery.
customer_reviews.author: GoyoP

customer_reviews.title: they might be better for loose sand
customer_reviews.text: these didn't go in to packed and loose sand as well as I had hoped. they might be better for loose sand only
customer_reviews.author: Motherhood.Squared

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not quite sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: Strong, but not quite strong enough for hard-packed dirt. They split down the seams under hard driving.
customer_reviews.author: misternickjones

product_meta.title: MSR Cyclone 10" Tent Stake, 4 Pack
product_meta.description: The MSR cyclone tent stake uses a spiral design which is ideal for creating a solid anchor point in soft soil or for securing large shelters and tarps in a windy environment. Constructed of lightweight 7000-series aluminum, the cyclone stake offers strength and holding power in all conditions. Each stake weighs 1.2 ounces and measures ten inches. A reflective pull loop allows for easy removal. Sold as a kit of four stakes. MSR products are covered by a three year limited warranty against manufacturing defects in materials and worksmanship.
feature_bullets: Spiral design tent stakes is ideal for creating a solid anchor point in soft soil
Features reflective pull loop allows for easy removal
Weighs 1.2 ounces and measures Ten inches
Sold as a kit of four stakes

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
